bio:treatment.description: Plants annual. Spikelets with parallel or diverging sides in outline, terete to moderately laterally compressed, with 4-11 florets. Lower glumes 1-3-veined; upper glumes 3-5-veined; lemmas lanceolate to linear-lanceolate, rounded over the midvein, apices acuminate, teeth 0.8-5 mm; awns straight or arcuate, arising 1.5 mm or more below the lemma apices.
bio:treatment.discussion: Bromus sect. Genea is native to Europe and northern Africa; five of its six species are established in the Flora region.
